stream_context.summary: Kaze, Zeina and Biobak iterate on Course 11 – an oil-rig level where Bowser’s minions stage a labour strike. Tasks include texture tweaks, new enemy models, protest dialogue, Goomba/Wiggler animations, performance tuning on real N64 hardware, and high-level planning for the Bowser-tower interior and Act-3 boss cut-scene.

development_findings.summary: Performance optimisation brought Course 11 to 25-29 FPS on an actual N64; only the distant tower is culled and back-face culling is selectively disabled to avoid pixel noise.
development_findings.quote: Considering how big of a level it is, to still get like 29 FPS, 27, fine. … That’s the only thing that’s being culled.

development_findings.summary: Act-structure finalised: Act 1 & 2 let players overhear Bowser complaining inside his office; Act 3 triggers a cut-scene where Bowser sends a strike-breaker oil-block that ‘eats’ Mario, starting the boss fight after the plaza is mysteriously emptied.
development_findings.quote: Mission three, everyone is striking and Bowser sends his strike breaker to stop the strike.

development_findings.summary: Interior design for Bowser’s tower: lobby → elevator → Bowser’s office with viewing window; secret ventilation shaft lets skilled players exit the elevator mid-ride to grab a hidden Yoshi coin.
development_findings.quote: We could make it so that you somehow escape the elevator while it’s going up … then you can get out and maybe go through an air vent.

development_findings.summary: Flattened-Goomba gag implemented: a single Goomba remains permanently squished with a correspondingly flattened dialogue box achieved by runtime matrix scaling.
development_findings.quote: The dialog box is squished but the text is not … now it works like that.

development_findings.summary: Worker-protest dialogue system built; Kaze uses ChatGPT plus Biobak’s puns, distributing ten lines across 6 Thwomps, 3 Koopas and 1 Goomba.
development_findings.quote: I’m making a level where Bowser’s minions are striking … Give me five short dialogues that the worker wants to say.

development_findings.summary: Oil-block enemy model created; texture palette revised from ‘brick of poop’ to a blue-rust dirty look, with white eyes and browned teeth for contrast.
development_findings.quote: Maybe his teeth should be brown a little bit … It’s a little out of place that you’ve got this dirty oil monster and he’s got nice teeth.

development_findings.summary: Wiggler rig fix: root bone had been on the chest; Zeina moves it to the first body segment so other bones remain animatable.
development_findings.quote: It’s clear why is it on his chest … I think the first body segment makes the most sense.

development_findings.summary: Most large textures already converted to CI8/CI4; further memory savings deemed minimal.
Multiplayer pencilled in post-Quaternion animation support; expected floor performance ~20 FPS.
development_findings.quote: I’m planning to add multiplayer after we have Quaternion animations … I think the lowest it will run is like 20 FPS.

development_findings.summary: Kaze floating long-term idea: an Ocarina of Time hack developed with a ‘professional studio’ workflow using GitHub, QA teams, open contributions.
development_findings.quote: We should develop like an Ocarina of Time hack … We’ll do it properly with GitHub and a QA team.

context_findings.summary: Kaze values replayability through player skill, not unlockables: no New Game Plus planned.
context_findings.quote: You get better at Mario, you find new shortcuts – that’s replayability.

context_findings.summary: Dislikes random meme inserts in serious hacks, considering them ‘cringe’.
context_findings.quote: Adding random memes to your hacks is just cringe … unless it’s specifically a meme hack.

context_findings.summary: Light-hearted stance on piracy, joking about ‘astral ray bit flips’ while distancing himself from actual infringement.
context_findings.quote: I would never pirate … that’s what I would say if I was a bad person.

context_findings.summary: Contemplates selling OST cartridges, boxes and manuals; will consult a lawyer about Nintendo samples and the trademark ‘Yoshi’.
context_findings.quote: I would have to look into whether it’s legal to sell the OST if it has a few samples that are also used in Mario 64.

context_findings.summary: Expressed satisfaction and mild relief after performance gains: ‘27 FPS is fine’.

biobak.summary: Supplied reference and will deliver two replacement textures for the oil-block; suggested lowering saturation and adding rust tones.
biobak.quote: I’ll just send you two textures and then you can do what you want.

biobak.summary: Mocked up window textures for Bowser’s office and recommended inset-extrude for depth; actively critiques overall colour balance.
Generated several pun-filled protest lines, e.g. ‘I’m built up, but tired of being taken for granite.’
biobak.quote: Biobak’s just naturally good at coming up with phrases.

zeina.summary: Spent the stream refining a complex Wiggler animation; moved the root bone and re-exported the rig.
zeina.quote: I’ll try animating the Wiggler … The first body makes the most sense, I’ll do that.

zeina.summary: Authored new Goomba animations: walk cycle, fall-then-flatten, and protest hop; delivered them to Kaze in-stream.
zeina.quote: It’s just a little hop – if you don’t use it, you don’t use it, but it’s there if you want it.

key_stories.title: Protest Dialogue Creation
key_stories.summary: Needed convincing strike slogans for Bowser’s unhappy minions. ChatGPT produced drafts, Biobak refined the puns, and Kaze distributed them across 10 NPCs.
key_stories.challenge: Write funny yet concise text that fits ROM limits.
key_stories.process: Iterative prompts to ChatGPT, manual curation, in-engine text ID assignment.
key_stories.outcome: Final dialogue set implemented; Goomba’s flattened speech bubble even scales visually.
key_stories.key_quote: This labor is crushing, and believe me, I know a thing or two about crushing.

key_stories.title: Rescuing the Wiggler Rig
key_stories.summary: Zeina discovered the root bone sat on Wiggler’s chest, limiting motion.
key_stories.challenge: Impossible to animate body segments independently.
key_stories.process: Discussion with Kaze; decided to relocate the root to first body segment and re-export.
key_stories.outcome: Rig now workable; Zeina continues animation.
key_stories.key_quote: Now you can’t animate him at all anymore – this doesn’t work at all.

key_stories.title: FPS Breakthrough on Course 11
key_stories.summary: Early builds lagged heavily on real hardware.
key_stories.challenge: Large, open level with many animated props.
key_stories.process: ‘Lots of little improvements’ plus selective culling and texture optimisation.
key_stories.outcome: Worst-case 25 FPS; Kaze calls it acceptable.
